;October 28, 2023, the actor who plays Chandler in the famous American sitcom "Friends" Matthew Perry was 54 years old and died of suspected drowning in a hot tub at his home in Los Angeles. Local law enforcement said "no drugs were found at the scene and there were no signs of foul play."

;

;The case is still under investigation, and no drugs have been found at the "scene" yet, but this does not mean that there is no drug abuse background in this case. In fact, Matthew has been addicted to alcohol and drugs since the first season of Friends in the mid-1990s. In his memoir "Friends, Lovers and the Big Terrible Thing," he said: He has been fighting drug addiction his whole life, during which he was near death twice, costing him as much as $9 million (equivalent to 65.85 million yuan). But he was still defeated in the end. At the worst point, he swallowed 55 pills of Vicodin (opioid analgesic) every day and drank 1 liter of vodka.

;

;Very similar to this incident, on February 11, 2012, the 48-year-old American singer Whitney Houston suffered a heart attack due to a drug overdose at the Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, Los Angeles. After losing consciousness, he slipped into the bathtub and drowned.

;

;Earlier, on June 25, 2009, American rock star Michael Jackson suffered a heart attack after his personal doctor Conrad Murray injected him with a fatal dose of propofol (a short-acting intravenous anesthetic). die. Prior to this, Jackson also used a large number of painkillers and anesthetics for many years.

;

;Under the banner of these big-name celebrities taking drugs, Americans are taking drugs and abusing addictive drugs extremely seriously. According to the classification standards of the National Center on Drug Abuse Statistics, there are eight main types of drugs: alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, heroin, fentanyl, methamphetamine (methamphetamine), opioids (controlled psychotropic substances), and prescription stimulants agent. The United States accounts for less than 5% of the world's population, but uses 80% of the world's opioids.

;

;According to data from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC): Among the approximately 280 million Americans aged 12 and above, there are approximately 31.9 million drug users. On average, 1 in 12 people takes drugs, accounting for 12% of the total number of drug addicts worldwide. On average, about 300 people die from drugs every day. Drug abuse kills 100,000 people every year, of which about 71,000 die from fentanyl abuse. The number of drug deaths is eight times that of Americans who die from gun accidents, far exceeding the number of Americans who die from AIDS, car accidents, and gun accidents. Of the total number of deaths, 70% were men between the ages of 25 and 54.

;

;The 2022 report of the "Joint Economic Committee of the U.S. Congress" pointed out that the abuse of opioids caused nearly 1.5 trillion US dollars in losses to the United States, accounting for about 7% of the GDP that year. In 2022, compared with before the outbreak of the "new crown epidemic", the United States will lose about 6.3 million labor force, about 20% of which are caused by drug abuse.

;

;No matter in terms of loss of life, economic loss, social security, moral corruption... the United States has fallen into a large-scale, long-term nationwide "opium crisis." Unlike the disaster in the late Qing Dynasty from 1840 to 1842, the Americans' "opium crisis" did not involve external force invasion. It was completely directed and acted by them: the youth group is the age group with the fastest growing number of drug addicts and the fastest growing number of deaths in the United States. 18 -The drug abuse rate among people aged 25 years old is 39%; among people aged 26-29 years old, it is 34%; and 70% people who have tried illegal drugs before the age of 13 have a clear trend of drug use at younger ages. This trend shows that traditional American values ​​are collapsing, just as Lee Kuan Yew talked about the dissipation of the "American spirit" in "China and the World".

;

;The former deputy secretary of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services said: The current drug and substance abuse in the United States is one of the most devastating public health disasters. This crisis is a reflection of the failure of multi-system supervision by the US government, and urgent, unified and comprehensive response measures are urgently needed. The National Public Radio (NPR) in the United States lamented that "American liberalism" has caused the tragedy of the United States.

;

;The "New Liberalism" (New Liberalism), also known as progressivism, which has led to the proliferation of drugs, is an ultra-left ideology. It is diametrically opposed to classical liberalism. The freedom advocated by the latter is the right to act according to one's own will without interfering with the rights of others. There is no freedom without law. Private property is inviolable and everyone is responsible for their own actions. The freedom it advocates is: behavior without any restrictions and without any consequences, that is, "do whatever you want, do whatever you want", and it is best for the government or society to pay the bill.

;

;American liberalism has set off many "progressive" social movements in the West through sexual liberation, sexual indulgence, drug use, decadent literature and art since the 1960s. It has continued for decades to this day, leading to the gradual disintegration of marriages and families, the proliferation of drugs, and rampant crime.

;

;The root cause of the "opium crisis" in the United States is difficult to eradicate. The U.S. police once said: If the strict anti-drug measures of Eastern societies were followed, more than one million drug dealers would have to be executed, all U.S. prisons would be emptied and the capacity would be expanded by ten. times, used for forced detoxification. But this is simply unimaginable in the United States and Western society.

;

;The U.S. Democratic Party government is engaged in "conceptual innovation": if drug use is legalized and it is not considered a crime, then won't the drug-related crime rate drop?

;

;First of all, drugs are divided into "hard drugs" and "soft drugs". Those with slightly less addictive and harmful effects, such as marijuana, are allowed to be used legally (for medical purposes) in 31 states in the United States. ), 10 states allow legal recreational use of marijuana. Then, Oregon passed "Bill 110" and became the first state in the United States to decriminalize the possession of "hard drugs" such as heroin, methamphetamine, and cocaine: possession of less than 1 gram of heroin, ecstasy, and less than 2 grams Cocaine, methamphetamine, less than 12 grams of psilocybin, less than 40 doses of hallucinogens, oxycodone, etc. will no longer be considered crimes and will instead be punished by a $100 fine or a health evaluation.

;

;This concept innovation has "remarkable results." The US "Capitol Hill" reported on August 28, 2022: A Gallup poll showed that the number of Americans smoking marijuana hit a record high, surpassing smoking for the first time. Number of people.

;

;In addition to the phased strategy of "hard drugs" and "soft drugs", the US pharmaceutical industry has also launched an "opioid (opium) prescription drug" strategy. Hill, director of the Robber Drug Rehabilitation Center in Ohio, believes that compared to other countries, Americans are more likely to choose drugs to relieve pain and release stress. The main driving force that contributed to the formation of this social culture was the "most generous marketing campaign in pharmaceutical history" that large American pharmaceutical companies invested heavily in in the mid-1990s.

;

;The most typical one is that in 1995, the American "Purdue Pharma" promoted Oxycontin (OxyContin) developed by it and took the lead in launching the "opioid harmless theory" propaganda campaign. After its launch, Within six years, Purdue sponsored 20,000 missionary projects. Opioid manufacturers and distributors spent $880 million over 10 years on marketing advertising.

;

;Opioid drugs greatly reduce the content of opium derivatives, and drug users take countermeasures to increase the amount of drugs they take. For example, Matthew, mentioned above, once swallowed 55 opioid analgesics every day, taking drugs in a "curve" way according to legal prescriptions prescribed by doctors.

;

;The deep-seated social problems caused by drugs include: drugs cause damage to the brain nerves of drug users, cause psychological abnormalities and cognitive impairment, induce mental illness, aggravate emotional agitation, lead to family crises, violent crimes, Problems such as psychological trauma in children; violent disasters such as gang crimes and homicides caused by drug trafficking affect social stability and generate upstream and downstream crimes such as money laundering. At the social level, the proliferation of drugs has reduced the labor base of American society and affected the average life expectancy of the American population; at the spiritual level, drugs and the crimes they induce have destroyed traditional values, annihilated justice and conscience, destroyed morality, and unleashed the worst evil in human nature. A devastating crime that breaks down society, shakes the foundation of the country, and destroys the spiritual and ideological foundation of future generations.

;

;The "opium crisis" in the United States has become difficult to recover from and will continue for a long time. The proliferation of drugs has become a chronic disease that is deeply hated by traditional groups in American society, but it is difficult to truly eradicate it.

;On May 23, members of the 2023 Mount Everest scientific expedition summit team were rushing to the summit;;

;

;For related reports, please see ";Memory of Glacier: Sixty Years of China's Scientific Expedition on Mount Everest;》

;

; In the past two years, I have often missed a world of yesterday that may not have existed. Just like Zweig described his father's generation, a generation blinded by idealism holds optimistic illusions, firmly believes that tolerance and friendship are indispensable binding forces, and sincerely believes that the boundaries and beliefs between various countries and sects are Differences will gradually be resolved through people's friendship, and the entire human race will enjoy the most precious wealth: peace and security.

;

;For various reasons, I have to face all kinds of people in my work and life, understand all kinds of ideas, communicate, get close, understand, and explain. And as my colleague M described it, I often want to "withdraw from human society immediately." At this time, I will choose some topics that have nothing to do with humans, animals or plants, rivers or mountains. Whether elephants run away or floods occur, whether glaciers melt or forest fires occur, these all reflect the insignificance and stupidity of human beings, as well as their concession and self-rescue.

;

;This was the original motivation for me to report on the scientific research on Mount Everest and the melting of glaciers. Simply put, even Mount Everest can detect DDT (;Organochlorine pesticides;), even the East Rongbuk Glacier. After losing ground, shouldn't humans put aside their prejudices and differences for the Himalayas, a young mountain range that spans five countries, and trust and cooperate with each other? Indeed, in interviews, glacier researchers generally view the world as one. Facing nature and the universe, disputes and conflicts lose their meaning.

;

;Although, global warming is not only about the environment, but also about fairness. The most vulnerable people and ecosystems have been disproportionately affected by loss and damage and are suffering from the adverse impacts of climate change that are disproportionate to their responsibility.

;

;Just like the debate on "rewriting literary history" and the humanistic spirit in the 1980s and 1990s, the intention to strip away one's stance in literature is a stance, and the intention is to transcend conscious biases to record scientific work. Perhaps It is a conscious choice in itself.

;

;In interviews in Lanzhou and Tibet, what unfolded before me was an open world, the endless treasure of the Creator. These scientists who are engaged in glacier research in western China love field scientific research, partly because they love freedom and pursue a free and unrestrained life. They can endure the hardship of being stationed at the foot of Mount Everest for ten years. This is because they are not stingy with their time and can feel the pulse of the earth. And the magnificent luck of Mount Everest.

;

;There was an interview in the evening. We were sitting on the playground of Lanzhou University. The interviewee told me that sometimes I sympathize with you big city people. With so much pressure, you will never be able to get out of the reinforced concrete city. forest. I suddenly thought of the birth of Impressionism: urbanites who experienced the industrial revolution began to dislike London, which was filled with industrial smog, and yearned for the countryside and nature. Later, born out of Impressionism, freer Fauvism, Cubism, and Expressionism were born. China has also completed its industrial revolution. Do Chinese people today also yearn for nature and countryside? Longing to leave the conflicts and struggles in the small environment or the big environment? Will this give rise to new cultural forms?

;

;Back to concerns about global warming and glacier melting. The guilt I feel is that some people who study glaciers and sense the pulse of the earth have scientifically proven that human activities have severely harmed the environment. It seems that they are not concerned about environmental changes.

;

;But recently, I read an exposition of Jin Guowei’s creation and felt somewhat comforted and even self-consistent. He is a world-renowned documentary director for his films such as "Free Climbing" and "Thailand Cave Rescue". He said: "I like to photograph the positive side of human nature, the qualities that can inspire us to become better. I have many friends who photograph human nature. The other side of the world is war, conflict, controversy. Obviously, I have not made a work on this theme. There are so many discouraging things happening in the world, which make people sad and angry. I hope to try to make something that can be related to I think this is the contribution I can make to the world."

;

;Recently, a video of a law enforcement officer in Hua County, Henan Province saying that a certificate is required to set up a fire party in rural areas has attracted great attention. The Huaxian Municipal Supervision Bureau issued a situation report on November 1, saying that law enforcement officers did not interpret the policy in a standardized manner, causing misunderstandings, and suspended them. However, this report was vague about the nature of the incident, which aroused greater doubts among netizens.

;

;According to netizens, they were preparing to have a dinner in their yard when several law enforcement officers suddenly arrived. In the video, a uniformed staff member said, "As long as you set up a fire, it is considered a business. If you have a group dinner, you must apply for a food safety license and a food business license. If you do not apply, you will be fined." Faced with doubts from netizens, law enforcement officers Take out a copy of the Food Safety Law and indicate that there is a legal basis for requesting a certificate. This aroused great doubts among netizens. Many people commented under the video: "Do I need a permit to cook at home?" "I invited some relatives to my house for dinner a few days ago and didn't apply for a permit. Is it illegal?" " I plan to invite a few friends to my home for dinner in the next few days. Where can I apply for a certificate?"

;

;After becoming a hot spot on the Internet, the Huaxian Municipal Supervision Bureau reported that on October 17, the bureau received a report that a certain village There was a dinner party in a courtyard. After the law enforcement officers arrived at the scene, they "found that this was not a normal wedding and wedding gathering in rural areas. Five people were preparing dishes and cleaning tableware on the scene. The processing environment was simple and open-air. There were no 'three prevention' facilities. The operators did not hold valid health certificates. There were Serious safety hazards can easily lead to food safety incidents and endanger people's health. Law enforcement officers explained relevant laws and regulations to the above-mentioned personnel and persuaded them to stop processing behaviors." "During the law enforcement process, law enforcement officers did not interpret the policy in a standardized manner, which caused The masses misunderstood. The comrade was ordered to make an in-depth inspection and be suspended from duty."

;

;To be honest, this announcement is confusing. The previous paragraph seems to say that law enforcement is no problem. It’s just that law enforcement officers’ interpretation of the policy is not standardized enough. If that's the case, it's just a small mistake and doesn't warrant suspension, right? Just criticize and educate, and then learn standardized policy interpretations.

;

;But if I read the first paragraph carefully, the more I read, the more confused I become. The scene was "not a normal wedding and wedding gathering." What kind of dinner was that? Is it normal to gather for weddings and weddings, but is it abnormal to gather for other gatherings? Do we need a certificate for “normal” weddings and weddings? Or is it only needed for “abnormal” dinner parties? What kind of dinner party is this? How many people are at the dinner party? Are the five people preparing food on site also part of the party, or are they the chefs they hired? The answers to these questions are different, and the nature of the events may be completely different.

;

;If this is just a dinner party between family and friends, and the person preparing the food is also part of the dinner party, then there is absolutely no reason for the so-called law enforcement. If you have a dinner party with relatives and friends and cook and eat by yourself, do you need to apply for a food safety certificate or food business license? Of course not. There is no such provision in any law. The so-called "simple processing environment, open-air operation, no 'three prevention' facilities, and operators without valid health certificates" and so on do not violate any laws. Rural gatherings, no matter whether they are weddings, weddings or other reasons, if there are many people, it is common for the host to cook in the open air in his own yard. The host is too busy, so relatives and friends help out. Do we still need relatives and friends to provide health certificates? As long as your relatives don't dislike it, the regulatory authorities have no reason to intervene.

;

;It is also possible that the person preparing the food is a chef specially hired by the host. For events with large gatherings of people, it is very common in some rural areas to hire professional chefs to serve at your doorstep. These chefs generally have a fixed team and provide mobile services in neighboring villages and charge service fees. This is indeed a commercial catering service, and it seems that the relevant personnel are required to apply for health certificates, food business licenses, etc. There are laws to follow. But the problem is that the food business licensing regulations formulated by the former State Administration of Food and Drug Administration require "one license for one place", which means that to conduct food business in one place, you must obtain a license. For mobile catering services, this requirement is difficult to achieve. It is impossible to go to the regulatory authorities in advance to apply for a license every time you serve a place. Not to mention that it is difficult for these temporary venues to meet the conditions stipulated in licensing regulations.

;

;Some people say that it may be managed as a food vendor. The Food Safety Law has relatively loose provisions on small food production and processing workshops and food vendors, and authorizes provincial governments to formulate specific management measures. However, in the "Henan Provincial Small Food Workshops, Small Business Stores and Small Stalls Management Regulations" passed by the Henan Provincial People's Congress in 2017, small food workshops and small business stores are required to have fixed production and business premises. Although small food stalls do not have fixed stores, they Stalls must also be set up at approved locations and within the specified time. Therefore, this regulation does not apply to mobile door-to-door catering services.

;

;What should we do if there are no clear regulations to follow? Based on the abstract provision in the Food Safety Law that "people engaged in food production, food sales, and catering services must obtain a license in accordance with the law," teams that provide mobile catering services are forced to apply for a license, and then they are refused and banned on the grounds that they do not meet the license conditions. , or should we follow the principle of modesty in administrative law enforcement and intervene as little as possible when there is no clear legal basis to rely on? The right choice should be self-evident. After all, rural areas are not full of restaurants like cities. Some places may be more than ten miles away from restaurants in towns, and transportation is not that convenient. It is unrealistic to travel across mountains and rivers to eat after finishing errands. Ignoring the actual needs of the rural public and using mechanical enforcement will only drive this market underground. Regulatory authorities should provide more services and less "enforcement", and especially should not threaten fines at every turn.

;

;On October 6, 2023, Ge Jianxiong was in a bookstore on Daxue Road, Shanghai;(Southern Weekend reporter Wei Cuicui/Photo);

;

;;Doctoral profile:;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong , the first doctor of history in New China (tied with Zhou Zhenhe). ;

;

;;On December 15, 1945, he was born in Nanxun Town, Wuxing County, Zhejiang Province (now Nanxun District, Huzhou City). ;

;

;;September 1957-July 1960, studied in junior high school at Chang'an Middle School in Shanghai. ;

;

;;From September 1960 to July 1964, he attended high school at Shibei Middle School in Shanghai, during which he took a year and a half of sick leave. ;

;

;;September 1964-July 1965, teacher training class of Shanghai Institute of Education, internship at Shibei Middle School. ;

;

;;From August 1965 to September 1978, he served as a teacher and secretary of the Youth League Committee of Gutian Middle School in Shanghai. ;

;

;;From October 1978 to November 1981, he was a graduate student in the History Department of Fudan University, studying under Mr. Tan Qixiang, and received his master's degree. ;

;

;;In December 1981, he stayed at the school to work. ;

;

;;In March 1982, he was an on-the-job doctoral candidate at the Institute of Chinese History and Geography at Fudan University, tutored by Professor Tan Qixiang. ;

;

;;In June 1983, he graduated early with the approval of the Ministry of Education. In October, he was awarded a doctorate in history from Fudan University. Together with Zhou Zhenhe, he was among the first batch of liberal arts graduates in the country. ;

;

;;In 1985, he was appointed associate professor; in 1991, he was appointed professor; in 1993, he was appointed doctoral supervisor. ;

;

;;From 1996 to 2007, he served as the director of the Chinese Institute of Historical Geography. ;

;

;;From 1999 to 2007, he concurrently served as the director of the Historical Geography Research Center, a key research base of the Ministry of Education. ;

;

;;From 2007 to 2014, he served as the Director of the Library of Fudan University. ;

;

;;From 2008 to 2018, he served as a member of the Standing Committee of the 11th and 12th National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference. ;

;

;;In 2014, he was appointed as a senior professor of liberal arts at Fudan University. ;

;

;;In 2016, he was hired as a librarian of the Central Research Institute of Literature and History and a librarian of the Shanghai Research Institute of Literature and History. ;

;

;;Retired in January 2020. ;

;

;In October 1978, green crops and soybeans were planted on the lawn of Fudan University. 32-year-old Ge Jianxiong entered the school and became a graduate student in historical geography.

;

;More than two months later, there were more lectures, and "ballroom dancing" became popular on campus. Ge Jianxiong, who was among them, also felt the vigorous vitality.

;

;Returning to college is not easy. In December 1945, Ge Jianxiong was born in Nanxun Town, Wuxing, Zhejiang. He hoped to apply for the classical literature major at Peking University, but he was diagnosed with lung disease during a physical examination in his second year of high school, and his studies were forced to interrupt. After losing the chance to take the college entrance examination twice in a row, he followed the teacher's advice and began training for teaching qualifications while preparing to take the college entrance examination.

;

;In August 1965, Ge Jianxiong officially became an English teacher at Shanghai Gutian Middle School. He thought he would be able to enter college after his health recovered, but instead he received news that the university had suspended admissions. Ge Jianxiong has spent more than ten years teaching at Gutian Middle School.

;

;The college entrance examination was resumed in 1977, and the age limit for taking the exam was 30 years old. The 31-year-old Ge Jianxiong was not eligible to take the exam. In 1978, graduate student enrollment was resumed and the age limit was relaxed to 40 years old, allowing Ge Jianxiong to quietly sign up. With a high school education, he was admitted to the History Department of Fudan University with the first score in the preliminary examination, and studied historical geography under Mr. Tan Qixiang. A few years later, by chance, Ge Jianxiong and his fellow student Zhou Zhenhe became the first two PhDs in history independently trained by China after the reform and opening up.

;

;Ge Jianxiong often mentioned Mr. Tan Qixiang’s ingenious metaphor about historical geography: If history is a drama, then geography is the stage, and history cannot work without this stage. Mentioning the relevance of this subject to ordinary people, Ge Jianxiong said that historical geography is omnipresent. "Whether it is the changes in the natural environment or the development of human geography, such as today's folk customs and intangible cultural heritage, they are all products of the historical geographical environment."

;

;As for the reason why he entered historical geography, Ge Jianxiong explained that even if he liked history since childhood, it was just a manifestation of blind curiosity in his youth until he became a graduate student at Fudan University in October 1978 and stayed at the school to work three years later. , only then decided to take historical geography as a lifelong career.

;

;Ge Jianxiong is also a scholar with quite a personality. He often said, "Don't be a nerd, don't be a hypocrite." Whether as a scholar or a member of the CPPCC, he always expressed his views outspokenly. In addition, he has traveled to Antarctica as a member of China's 17th Antarctic Expedition, climbed Mount Kilimanjaro, the "King of Africa", and visited Ali, Tibet, the "Roof of the World".

;

;On the last day of the National Day holiday in 2023, a Southern Weekend reporter met Ge Jianxiong in a bookstore on University Road in Shanghai. The 77-year-old man has gray hair and a slight stoop. He is wearing a dark blue cotton and linen shirt and dark gray trousers. He is carrying a white canvas bag filled with documents and books.

;

;;Missed the college entrance examination;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You once mentioned that you were unable to take the college entrance examination due to physical reasons in high school. What was the situation like at that time? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;My goal in high school was to major in classical literature at Peking University, but I was diagnosed with lung disease in May of my second semester of high school. Due to widespread malnutrition, three people in our class were diagnosed with lung disease. My condition was the most serious and I had to suspend school. I originally thought that I would be able to start my senior year of high school in time after taking a three-month break, but after an examination, I found that the lesions were not completely absorbed, so I ended up taking a year and a half out of school and studying with the next class in my senior year of high school. In May 1964, I still failed the physical examination for the college entrance examination and was unable to register. Under such circumstances, I could only work as a social youth, but my teacher suggested that I join the workforce. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What work have you done and what do you hope for the future? Planning? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;Shanghai Institute of Education was running a teaching qualification training course at that time, which was equivalent to a one-year college. We were sent to various key schools to receive training, and after one year we were officially assigned as teachers. ;

;

;At that time, I planned to become a teacher first, and wait until I recovered before taking the college entrance examination. I trained at my alma mater, Shibei Middle School. I like literature and history, and I wanted to teach Chinese. But the teacher in charge of my class was the Chinese teacher. He said that the Chinese teacher had to correct the compositions of two classes and the burden was too heavy. He knew that I planned to enter college and suggested that I teach English so that I could have more spare time for self-study. After one year of internship, on August 5, 1965, I reported to Gutian Middle School and officially became a teacher.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What other preparations have you made for the college entrance examination? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong: ;;Not long after I started working, in September 1965, the night school department of Shanghai International Studies University enrolled students, and I applied. Starting from October of that year, we had English classes two nights a week. I thought I would have the opportunity to enter university after working for two years, but when the Cultural Revolution began in 1966 and the university closed down, my hope was dashed. The university resumed enrollment in 1977, but the age requirement was 30 years old. I was over the age and had no chance. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Applying for graduate school with a high school degree, similar exceptions are available for admission Was it common at the time? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;When the country resumed postgraduate enrollment, the "People's Daily" published an article proposing to reduce talents in any way. Many regulations have been broken. For example, a high school diploma is required to enter college, but nothing is required to enter graduate school. The age is also relaxed to 40 years old. ;

;

;It was reported in the news at that time that some people graduated from elementary school and were admitted to graduate school. There was also a Shandong student who had studied with his father since he was a child and had never set foot on campus and was admitted to graduate school. The oldest among the first batch of graduate students was Qian Liqun, who was born in 1939, and the youngest recruited by Fudan was born in 1957.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You originally wanted to study classical philology, but why did you apply for Fudan University? Historical geography? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;I got married in March 1978 and registered for the exam in May or June. My wife wanted me to stay in Shanghai. ;

;

;I really wanted to study classical philology when I was in high school, but later I found that history was more practical and safer. I didn’t know what historical geography was at first, but I liked both history and geography, so I applied for this subject.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Did the application process go smoothly? What was your mentality at the time? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;I prepared quietly for the first test and did not dare to tell the employer. I don't place any hope on the exam. If I can pass it, I will take it. If I fail, I won't be ashamed. ;

;

;The examination room was at Shanghai Institute of Technology, which is now the Yanchang Road campus of Shanghai University, two or three kilometers away from Gutian Middle School. At eight o'clock in the morning, I organized the flag-raising on the school radio and lectured the students. It took about a quarter of an hour to complete these tasks, and then I rode a bicycle for ten minutes to take the exam.

;

;After the preliminary test results came out, I ranked first. Only after I was able to take the re-examination did I start preparing seriously. I went to the public reading room of the Shanghai Library to borrow professional reference books, such as "Selected Readings of Ancient Chinese Geography Classics". At that time, there was only one copy. It had been borrowed when I went there on the first day. I went to borrow it very early the next day to get it. , and it was also at this time that I met the classmates who later re-examined together.

;

;But in fact, middle school has known it for a long time. After I enrolled in the school, the old branch secretary of the school accidentally told me that after seeing the preliminary test scores, Fudan University suspected that I had falsified my high school diploma and had sent someone to Gutian Middle School to learn about the situation.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You had been working at Gutian Middle School for more than ten years when you were admitted to graduate school. Did you Are you still worried that the school won’t let you go? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong: ;;Yes. I was responsible for student affairs at the school and also served as the full-time Youth League Committee Secretary. I introduced the first batch of League members in the school. In 1977, I was selected as an advanced worker in education in Shanghai, and later became a deputy to the Shanghai Municipal People’s Congress. ;

;

;However, the leaders of the Zhabei District Education Bureau specifically called the school to express their attitude - if I am admitted to graduate school, it means that the country needs me to go to graduate school more, and the school must release me unconditionally. .

;

;;

;

;In October 1983, President Xie Xide of Fudan University (left) awarded Ge Jianxiong a doctorate degree. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;;Exceptional award of doctorate degree;

;

; ;Southern Weekend:;;October 1978 was the time you entered school. Was there any change in the atmosphere at the school at that time? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;Not long after we entered school, the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee was held, and the school ushered in earth-shaking changes. ;

;

;When I first entered Fudan, green crops were still growing on the school lawn, and bright red big-character posters were posted on the main road, Nanjing Road. After the plenary session, the big-character posters were removed, scar literature caused heated debates among students, and more and more lectures were given. Some students proposed improving the treatment of intellectuals. While the views they put forward were not necessarily mainstream, they were passionate.

;

;Deng Xiaoping’s speech proposed that it must be ensured that scientific and technological personnel must spend at least five-sixths of their time in business work a week. Our political study time has been significantly reduced, to half a day a week. In the past, we would have meetings and study all day long, and individuals had to attend.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What are the course arrangements after enrollment? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong: ;;During the master’s period, the school offers public courses, including politics and foreign languages. I chose English, German and Japanese. ;

;

;Mr. Tan offers professional courses. When he enrolled, Mr. Tan was still hospitalized. He gave us the first class in the foyer of Shanghai Longhua Hospital. After two lectures, I thought the foyer was too noisy. Mr. Tan happened to have a student working at the Shanghai Dictionary Publishing House, so he asked someone to find a house for the publishing house near Longhua Hospital. In this way, Mr. Tan gave us a semester of professional courses.

;

;The school does not offer other professional courses and requires tutors and departments to resolve the issues themselves. Most of the courses are offered by tutors.

;

;We have geography internships starting from this year. In 1979, two teachers took five of us graduate students to Yangzhou, Zhenjiang and Nanjing to conduct formal "academic mountain climbing" and observe geological structures.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You chose to stay in school after graduation and started working and studying at the same time Bo, what's the opportunity in this? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong: ;;After I graduated with my master's degree, I was assigned a job. My family is in Shanghai, so I stayed in school smoothly, serving as Mr. Tan's assistant and undertaking scientific research tasks. In the spring of 1982, the country began to officially recruit doctoral students. At that time, doctoral supervisors had to go to Beijing for evaluation. It was not until 1992 that Peking University, Tsinghua, Fudan and other universities could evaluate at their own school, and they had to report to the Ministry of Education for registration. After Mr. Tan was named a doctoral supervisor in 1981, he recruited Zhou Zhenhe and me in 1982. ;

;

;On the whole, the number of doctoral students recruited in the first batch is very small, with only a dozen or so in the Liberal Arts Department of Fudan University.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;As the first batch of Ph.D.s, what is your training method? Is there a relatively clear training plan? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong: ;;There is no standardized training method, and I don’t know what the above requirements are. After discussing with us, Mr. Tan decided to study on his own first and ask him for advice if he had any questions. Since I am his assistant and follow him all day long, I can ask for advice at any time.  ;

;

;Because the number of doctoral students is small, the school does not offer courses specifically for doctoral students, so we don’t know what courses are available. However, considering that there is a thesis requirement for doctoral graduation, we began to prepare the doctoral thesis shortly after the semester started in 1982.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In September 1983, after more than a year of doctoral studies, you and Zhou Zhenhe was specially approved by the Ministry of Education to graduate early, which seems incredible today. ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;In May 1983, the first batch of Ph.D.s in science appeared in China. The evaluation is based on the master's thesis, and if it reaches the doctoral level, it can be recognized as a doctorate. At that time, 18 people from across the country passed, and 4 from Fudan, namely Hong Jiaxing, Zhang Yinnan, Tong Yusun and Li Shaokuan. At the meeting of the school’s academic degree committee, Mr. Tan asked whether Zhou Zhenhe’s and I’s papers could also be recognized as doctoral thesis because they were also of high quality. However, Principal Su Buqing objected. He believed that the expressions of science subjects such as mathematics and physics have international standards, while liberal arts are Chinese subjects and have no international standards.  ;

;

;At that time, the school already had the first batch of science Ph.D.s, but no liberal arts Ph.D.s. If you wanted to strengthen your strength, this was an entry point. Jiang Yihua, the then department chair, learned that Tsinghua University and Peking University did not yet have liberal arts PhDs, so he asked whether Fudan could strive to cultivate the first batch of liberal arts PhDs in China. They specifically approached the Vice Minister of Education Huang Xinbai, and the result was that exceptions could be made, but all courses must meet the standards.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How do you meet the standards required by the Ministry of Education? No twists and turns? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;Zhou Zhenhe and I completed the closed-book politics exam. For professional courses, Mr. Tan prepared test papers based on our situation. In addition, foreign language scores are also required. Zhou Zhenhe and I both took English and Japanese during our master's degrees, and our Japanese scores were over 80 points. We proposed that the first foreign language test be English, and the second foreign language should be replaced by the Japanese scores during the master's degree. The Ministry of Education agreed. ;

;

;For the thesis defense in August 1983, we invited Hou Renzhi and Shi Nianhai. However, after the defense date was set, the written approval from the Ministry of Education for our early graduation has not yet been issued. When the school learned that Huang Xinbai was having a meeting in Harbin, it sent someone to Harbin to find him to sign. The night before the defense, they made a long-distance call and said that our defense was "legal" only after Huang Xinbai approved it.

;

;The degree awarding ceremony will be held in September. At that time, the doctoral certificates were numbered nationwide. The first 18 numbers were for science. Zhou Zhenhe was numbered 19th and I was numbered 20th. With a clear conscience, although we graduated early as an exception, we did not take things lightly.

;

;There is another episode. We were supposed to have professional titles after graduation, but due to the rectification of professional titles, it was not until 1985 that the assessment of professional titles was resumed, and Zhou Zhenhe and I were promoted to associate professors. I was named a professor in 1991 and became a doctoral supervisor in 1993. From the time I was studying for a Ph.D. to becoming a professor, I was able to continue doing academic work. If not for the reform and opening up, I would never have had these opportunities.

;

;;

;

;In May 1981, Ge Jianxiong (3rd from left) and his mentor Tan Qixiang (2nd from left), Zhou Youguang (1st from right) and Zhang Yunhe (1st from left). ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;;How come toys must make you lose your mind? ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You often mentioned Mr. Tan’s opinions on acting and The metaphor of a stage, so what is the value and significance behind studying the stage where history takes place? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;Historical geography is the study of geographical conditions in historical periods, including natural topography such as mountains, rivers, and humanities, Such as politics, economy and culture. The stage is an abstract metaphor, which actually refers to all geographical conditions, geographical elements and geographical distribution in the past. The value behind it lies in how we apply it. It is a science in itself and an objective law. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;For the discipline of historical geography, What did it mean for you to receive your PhD in 1983? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;Everyone agrees that historical geography was basically formed in the 1980s. But for a subject to become a knowledge, at least there must be people studying the basic fields. ;

;

;When the Fudan University Library was organizing its centenary exhibition, it asked me for a topic, and it was finally decided to be "The Legend of the End of the Fire". I took out a few exhibits. The first one is Mr. Tan's university graduation thesis - "History of Chinese Immigration". His instructor was Mr. Pan Guangdan. This manuscript also contains Pan Guangdan's comments. The second item is a six-volume history of Chinese immigration that I edited. The third thing is the books published by my students on the history of Chinese population and Chinese immigration. There are about six kinds of books. There are also many doctoral theses written by their students.

;

;Our four generations have focused on the topic of Chinese immigration history, from unpublished university thesis manuscripts, to compiled six volumes, to so many papers, and we have truly passed it down.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Combined with your own experience and feelings, the development of historical geography and What is the connection between reform and opening up?  ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;In general, historical geography used to be a very small subject. Later, thanks to Mr. Tan's "Atlas of Chinese History" and everyone's continuous efforts after the reform and opening up, the social visibility of the subject was improved. If he could not seek truth from facts when studying historical geography, Mr. Tan would be very painful. However, the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee restored the line of seeking truth from facts. On such a major issue as historical maps, Mr. Tan received support from the central government. Mr. Tan was very moved. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After so many years of research, what is your understanding of historical geography? What deeper understanding has there been of the subject? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;After entering this discipline, I feel that the development of the discipline is inseparable from the line of seeking truth from facts. ;

;

;In fact, Marx’s historical materialism fully affirms the role of material foundation in history, and historical geography studies the stage and material foundation of history. If Marxist materialism can be used as technical guidance, historical and geographical research can naturally serve reality.

;

;Some major issues can be explained from the perspective of historical geography, while exploring the positive and negative roles played by geographical conditions in the process of historical development. For example, Mr. Tan proposed in 1962 that the fundamental reason for the long-term steady flow of the Yellow River after the Eastern Han Dynasty was the change in land use patterns in the middle reaches, which greatly reduced soil erosion. The good degree of vegetation maintenance in the middle reaches of the Yellow River determines the severity of soil erosion. Therefore, farming or animal husbandry in the middle reaches directly affects the safety of the lower reaches of the Yellow River. He proposed that the middle reaches of the Yellow River cannot be all engaged in agriculture, and should be adapted to local conditions. Farming should be done if it is suitable for agriculture, pastoral should be used for grazing, and forest should be used for forestry. It needs to be comprehensively developed and fully utilized.

;

;Although this view has been criticized, its advanced accuracy has been fully proven after the reform and opening up. This is now the case in the middle reaches of the Yellow River, with some returning farmland to forests and some returning farmland to grassland.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After becoming a doctoral supervisor in 1993, based on your past life experiences, you What are the differences in admissions? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong:;;I am an eclectic person, and several students were recruited with the approval of the school. ;

;

;Like my student Ma Menglong, he failed the doctoral entrance examination, but after talking with him, I found that he has great potential, has strong logical thinking, and is very good at using his brain. I encouraged him to go back and review before taking the exam. Later, I felt that it was not enough to let him review by himself, so I decided to recruit him specially. The school stipulates that academicians and tutors who have produced hundreds of outstanding doctoral theses across the country can be specially recruited. I took advantage of this right and came up with the questions myself. After he answered the questions, I graded the results and handed the papers to the school.

;

;In the first year of recruitment, Ma Menglong couldn’t understand the class and was very anxious. I advised him not to worry, I believe you can follow me. Later, he slowly came to his senses, and his graduation thesis was of a very high standard, and even won the top 100 in the country. If I were not given autonomy, this kind of student would never be able to get in.

;

;In fact, Fudan has this tradition, which stipulates that academicians and doctoral supervisors who have produced top 100 papers have the right to recruit special talents. Then we should make full use of this right to discover special talents. As Mr. Tan advocates, on the one hand, we must abide by the system, but on the other hand, we must leave room for special circumstances.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In addition to academic research, Notice You is also a mobile game Academic consultants participate in the construction of the historical values ​​​​of the game. What is your original intention for doing this, and how do you understand the relationship between play and learning? ;

;

;;Ge Jianxiong: ;;We need to correct a misconception. In ancient times, it was said that playing with things makes you lose your morale. How come playing with things must make you lose your morale? Can you keep your ambition without playing? Modern society is all about production, material rather than spiritual, but people have the right to play, and citizens' right to play should be protected. ;

;

;But don’t expect to learn history by playing, that’s ridiculous. A nation that does not pay attention to history is pathetic, and a nation that can only learn history through games is even more pathetic. History is very serious and must be studied seriously.

;

;I serve as an academic advisor for mobile games, just to make sure that the values ​​of the game are okay. As long as the game is harmless, it is fine, but the values ​​​​must be correct. I once suggested to them to avoid causing harm to young people, and later strengthened supervision through secondary certification.

;;2023-11-05 18:00:00;
;

;Recently, an incident in which "a young lady called the police and claimed that she was abandoned by a travel partner" has attracted public attention.

;

;On October 27, a woman posted a video on social media, saying in tears that "she was abandoned by her travel partner" and that she had already called the police. According to her description, there were five people in this "travel group", including a couple and two men besides her. The group started traveling by car from Chengdu, and Daocheng Yading was the last stop. We originally agreed to drive back to Chengdu in the evening after climbing the mountain on the 27th. The woman involved said that when she came back at seven o'clock that night, she found that the other four people had abandoned her and gone back first, and had stored her luggage in the hotel.

;

;On October 29, events took a turn. Another woman who was traveling with her posted a clarification, pointing out several facts. First, the pick-up group had repeatedly emphasized to the woman in advance that they would meet at the foot of the mountain at 16:30 that day and then drive back to Chengdu, but the woman ultimately ignored this; second, everyone urged her many times to no avail and could not contact her. at 18:30, she finally gave up and left, but stored her luggage at the hotel and shared her experience on the return route; third, after the woman involved called the police, the police also confirmed that they were not responsible for the matter.

;

;Looking at the entire incident, it can be seen that the woman involved completely ignored the agreement between the "travel partners" and acted arbitrarily in the AA-style escort group, and always asked others to "help her" in the process. "Leave her alone", claiming that it is not your prerogative. The most critical thing is that she failed to fulfill the punctual obligation of "meeting at 16:30" that the group had repeatedly confirmed, and she couldn't be contacted in the middle of the trip, so the other partners had no choice but to leave early.

;

;To be fair, after all, travel groups are very different from travel agency group tours. It is completely possible to "discuss everything" on specific matters, as long as it wins the consent of the majority of people or does not hinder other members rights and interests. Taking this incident as an example, the woman involved could have disagreed with the meeting time in advance and tried to persuade others to postpone the meeting. Of course, the woman involved could also offer to give others a certain amount of financial compensation and wait until she came back before setting off; that was really not possible. , you can also declare to "leave the group" without interfering with each other, eliminating the need for subsequent disputes.

;

;In fact, problems similar to "tourists not arriving at the meeting point at the specified time" will also occur in group tours of travel agencies, which has also caused many disputes. Whenever a similar situation occurs, there are always two directions. The first is that "a group of people are waiting for one person" but they dare not speak out and allow tourists who do not abide by the contract to damage the rights and interests of others; the second is that the travel agency "does not tolerate him" after seeking the consent of the tourists present and gathers them to leave first.

;

;In March 2023, during a dispute over the "One-day trip to Beijing Olympic Park" involving a tour group from Tianjin, the tour guide asked to gather at 15:00, but tourist Song and four other people did not arrive until 15:30 because of their children. At the meeting point, the tour guide car has left at this time, and tourists have to return to Tianjin on their own. Song and others requested the travel agency to refund a total of 8,490 yuan including all travel expenses, liquidated damages, self-return expenses, and mental damages. After the trial, the court held that Song and others had breached the contract and the travel agency had no liability for compensation, and dismissed the plaintiff's lawsuit.

;

;If travel agencies have obligations to abide by contracts and need to bear liability for breach of contract, then the same is true for tourists. Put it in the scenario of "travel hook-ups", that is, every hook-up has an obligation to keep the contract, and they also need to bear the same liability for breach of contract. Of course, partners can also reach different proportions of rights and obligations distribution plans, and women can also receive some care, such as "help her and let her" in this incident, but this does not mean that the woman involved can Regardless of breach of contract, unless she really treats other partners as personal tour guides.

;

;Details of this case show that the five-person group that set off this time did not reach any form of written contract, so there is no way to talk about their respective rights and obligations stipulated in black and white. The travel agreement between the group members was reached in the form of a verbal contract, and the only written form was nothing more than "WeChat group chat records." After the woman in question withdrew from the group, the chat records became incomplete, which once affected the determination of facts and gave the woman in question room to gain a head start and "preemptively draw pictures" on social media.

;

;In fact, although "travel partners" are much more flexible than travel agency group tours, they still have to abide by the contract reached between each other so that the entire team can successfully complete the journey. "Travel partner" can be regarded as a tiny autonomous group. The success of the journey depends on the contractual spirit, organizational ability, communication and coordination ability of each team member. To put it bluntly, it is how to adjust the relationship between "individual" and "team" The relationship of rights and obligations between each other, so that each partner has "equal rights and responsibilities" in the itinerary, only in this way can the situation of everyone be improved.

;

;Compared with the standard contracts and team formats of travel agencies and group tours, the travel format of "travel partners" is full of more flexibility and uncertainty, which also tests the comprehensive skills of team members. Qualities include but are not limited to physical fitness, interpersonal skills, self-rescue ability, adaptability, etc. This case also shows that in addition to safety issues, contract issues have arisen in the emerging business of travel hookups.

;

;Freedom is not free, it also means responsibility. Even if it is a "go as you please" and "flexible" travel group, this kind of freedom does not mean that you can do whatever you want, and it cannot evolve into the behavior of letting others foot the bill at any time. Since the tour group has delegated the freedom of travel to each partner, it also requires each partner to fulfill their own responsibilities, abide by the contracts reached with other partners, and be responsible for their own choices at any time and bear the costs. , you can enjoy the joy of traveling with strangers.

;

;Shoes suspected of containing secret camera equipment. On November 3, 2023, He Jun appeared in court wearing this pair of shoes. Internet screenshots

;

;The incident of a man being suspected of being secretly photographed on the subway in Chengdu originated on June 1, 2023. The person involved, He Jun (pseudonym), wrote in a long post on Weibo that he was secretly photographed on the subway by a small camera hidden in his shoes. He was then carried to the platform by a subway security guard and stood with one foot off his shoes and socks. span>;;The crowd; watches.

;

;He Jun believes that this process is like a shadow in life. For this reason, he went through many twists and turns and brought the two women involved and the Chengdu Metro to the court, demanding a public apology and financial compensation. The incident occurred a week after a Sichuan University girl falsely accused migrant workers of secretly filming her, and thus attracted much attention.

;

;Nearly half a year after the incident, on November 3, 2023, He Jun sued two women for a general personality rights dispute in the Chengdu Railway Transportation First Court. . The trial lasted for two and a half hours that day, and no verdict was announced in court. He Jun said on Weibo that when he recalled the entire process during the trial, he still felt very uncomfortable and had to constantly restrain his emotions.

;

;Liu Dan, He Jun’s attorney, mentioned, “Leave aside the issue of men and women, any person can defend themselves when their rights and interests are threatened. own rights." Liu Dan said that he understood the behavior of the woman involved in standing up bravely when she suspected that she was being secretly photographed; but with such rights, she should also bear corresponding obligations. After discovering that it was a misunderstanding, the woman involved;The child; should apologize proactively.

;

;;

;

;He Jun described the incident on Weibo, accompanied by diagrams of each scene. Internet screenshots

;

;Unacceptable apology

;

;He Jun has told the story of the incident many times on different occasions. For the first time, He Jun wrote a long article on Weibo based on his own memories, and always kept this article at the top of Weibo. After the case entered the investigation and evidence collection stage, He Jun made additional corrections to some details based on the contents of surveillance videos and law enforcement recorders, and gradually updated them on Weibo.

;

;On June 11, 2023, He ;Jun; took the subway home from Xipu, Chengdu. When he arrived at the South Railway Station, there was Two girls said they saw the green light flashing on his shoes and suspected that he was filming secretly. According to the video provided by passengers in the same carriage, two girls pointed at his shoes and said, "It's shining, it's not reflecting light, it's shining." "When we were filming, he put it on closed".

;

;After the train safety officer of the car arrived, He Jun took off his shoes in public according to the girl's request. After the train safety officer and the two girls checked, no camera was found. .

;

;He Jun recalled to Southern Weekend reporters before the court session that during this process, everyone on the train suddenly focused their attention on him, and some people deliberately looked out. When he looked up, he saw someone was taking pictures with a mobile phone, which already made him feel uncomfortable.

;

;Another place that made him feel uncomfortable was when he arrived at the station. The security officer and the station attendant arranged for him to stand against the wall and take off his right shoe. He Jun said that the environment he was in at that time was a public place connected to the platform. Passengers coming and going could see him taking off his right shoe and socks and standing next to the wall.

;

;"I think this matter is not final. I was just a suspect at the time, so we should consider reducing some of the impact, such as taking me to a In a place with few people, maybe use something to block me, that’s what I thought.” He Jun believed that this was something Chengdu Metro did improperly.

;

;Liu Dan, He Jun's attorney, told Southern Weekend reporters that they added Chengdu Metro as a defendant precisely because Chengdu Metro had problems with expanding the damage. It is true that the subway security officer did not force He Jun to take off his shoes or search him, but after a preliminary check that he was not secretly photographed, he could consider finding an office where the two parties could sit down and negotiate and wait for the police to arrive. Liu Dan said that in the case, He Jun also took the initiative to call the police.

;

;After taking off He Jun's shoes for inspection, the police confirmed that there was no camera. The police also showed a restored video taken at the same location on the subway, and speculated that the advertising plates on both sides were reflected on the shiny surface of the shoes, reflecting green light. After mediation by the police, the two ;; ;girls; apologized to He Jun.

;

;He Jun is not satisfied with this apology. He said that according to the video content of the law enforcement recorder reviewed afterwards, the older female student said "I'm sorry, handsome man", and the younger female student said immediately "We I have wronged you." "The entire sentence did not take more than two seconds," He Jun said. They were ;wearing; masks and could not hear clearly.

;

;In the long article recorded by He Jun afterwards, the police mediation was still continuing, and the girl ;; emphasized that she was speaking for the public. , to prevent other people's privacy from being infringed, and He Jun emphasized that the two ;girls; ;girls; had a "meal-eating" mentality to share their experiences with their friends.

; "After they apologized, I think they may have made up their minds (to defend their rights)," He Jun said. The next day, he took the initiative to post the experience online with the subject "I was falsely accused of being secretly filmed by wearing a shoe-covered camera on the Chengdu subway." ", hoping to record the progress of his rights protection, and also hope to find ;eyewitnesses; in the same carriage through the Internet. The post quickly attracted attention.

;

;;

;

;A diagram posted by He Jun on Weibo. Internet screenshot

;

;Do not support using violence to fight violence

;

;He Jun's rights protection process was not smooth. At first, He Jun could not find any evidence such as video of the scene to prove the place of occurrence, which made it impossible to file a case in court for investigation and evidence collection. After many twists and turns, a man in the same carriage provided a signed certificate stating that the incident had occurred on Chengdu Metro Line 1, and the case was officially filed on August 15. During subsequent evidence collection, Chengdu Metro informed the platform that the monitoring equipment was damaged and the video was missing. On September 27, after communicating with his lawyer, He Jun added Chengdu Metro as a defendant in the prosecution case. The main reason was that Chengdu Metro was suspected of breach of contract and infringement.

;

;Although some netizens demanded "severe punishment", He Jun has not disclosed the two ;names;;Girls; appearance, name and other private information. He does not support the method of "responding to violence with violence." "I have never had such an idea, and I have been calling on the media and netizens not to (defame or bully the other party online)."

;

;Ding Yaqing, a lawyer at Guangdong Zhiheng (Guangzhou) Law Firm, has represented cases involving sexual harassment liability disputes. She believes that the two women involved suspected that someone was filming secretly and found the subway security officer to intervene in the verification. There was no problem in itself. In some situations where sexual harassment is alleged, finding a third party to intervene can help resolve the dispute.

;

;The key is that after the facts were clarified, this man spent time and energy to cooperate with the investigation and was scrutinized in public. "He felt bad." Therefore, it is necessary and reasonable to demand an apology and explanation. "The core problem for the girls in this case is that the process of ; and ; apologizing was not explained in the end."

;

;On the other hand, Ding Yaqing believes that Chengdu The train safety officers of the subway do not have the power to enforce the law, and their actions may not be appropriate in this regard. "I noticed that the person involved said that the security officer carried him away," Ding Yaqing said. This ;suggested; whether the security officer exceeded his authority to conduct a search. She suggested that in places such as subways where sexual harassment accusations are prone to occur, staff should be trained, such as how to respond when such accusations occur, what are the staff's scope of authority, how to appease both parties, etc.

;

;She believes that the response to sexual harassment accusations in public places can be compared to passengers encountering theft on the subway or bus - find a third party, The police, who have law enforcement powers, do not need to raise the issue of differences between men and women and gender antagonism.

;

;Ding Yaqing analyzed that in general personality rights infringement cases, the responsibilities stipulated by law include stopping the infringement, eliminating the impact, making an apology, etc. He Jun's current demands One is to publicly apologize, but whether the scope of disclosure refers to the place where the incident occurred or on social media such as Weibo, and to whom it is disclosed depends on the court hearing.

;

;Liu Dan said that since the case is not open to trial, the form of a public apology cannot be disclosed. ; Sun, 05 Nov 2023 16:25:03 +0800 9.4分科幻动画，每一帧都脑洞大开http://www.infzm.com/contents/259987
;;2023-11-05 15:00:00;
;

;According to "The Analysis of Dreams", people Can't imagine something I haven't seen before.

;

;But a recent American TV series has done it - "Reign of the Scavengers" (hereinafter referred to as "Reign").

;

;This science fiction drama is produced by HBO Max, and its Douban score is stable at 9.4 points.

;

;;

;

;Other science fiction The works are all trying to explain something clearly, or making it unclear to make the audience feel mysterious, but "Dominion" focuses on one thing: don't talk, feel first.

;

;01

;

;"Dominion" is adapted from the 2016 animated short "Scavengers" produced by Joe Bennett and Charles Huttner.

;

;This work has no dialogue throughout, and the storyline is almost non-existent: a spaceship breaks down and loses contact, and a pair of male and female scientists on board become the only survivors. Thus, the two people began a wonderful life on the alien planet.

;

;;

;

;It's like The alien version of "Pulse of the Earth" leads humans to experience a gorgeous adventure of imagination in a spectacular way.

;

;For example, bugs that can be used as telescopes and gas masks;

;

;;

;

;There is also a flying fish that can be used as a bamboo dragonfly when put into a backpack.

;

;;

;

;On this planet The creatures are beautiful, weird and absurd.

;

;The drama series "Dominion" is an all-round expansion and extension of the short film "Scavengers", developing the line of the spacecraft malfunctioning on the alien planet into three lines.

;

;The first line is the story of Sam and Ursula.

;

;Of these two people, one is a classic white man and the other is an independent and strong woman.

;

;;

;

;Two persons The creatures on this planet already have a certain level of understanding, and they can skillfully transform bugs into gas masks, and capture creatures to use as aircraft.

;

;In the process, we see that they still have a tendency to use living things as tools, but at the same time they have to be cautious, after all, they are surrounded by unknowns.

;

;;

;

;Article 2 Thread is the story of a black girl, Archie, and an artificial intelligence, Levi.

;

;As a robot, Levi originally simply received orders and performed tasks. But because a certain yellow creature on the planet gradually grew with its body, Levi seemed to have a will.

;

;;

;

;It will be in As you explore this planet at night, you will feel pain and begin to understand the lives of other creatures.

;

;;

;

;Article 3 The thread is the story of Carmen, the unshaven uncle.

;

;Carmen can hold up the entire line by himself because he has a connection with Blackie, a strange creature on the planet.

;

;;

;

;The card door is small Black hunts, and Black feeds Carmen by creating hallucinations.

;

;Carmen's wife died when the spacecraft landed, so he suffered from severe depression. Xiao Hei took advantage of Carmen's longing for his wife and mentally controlled Carmen, making her think that their symbiotic relationship was a normal couple's relationship.

;

;;

;

;Three lines The characters have a common purpose, which is to repair the damaged spacecraft and return to Earth. But those wonderful alien creatures brought them unspeakable shock.

;

;02

;

;The painting style of "Dominion" is weird and imaginative, and it seems to have an ethereal and lonely beauty.

;

;For example, plants that can turn corpses into landscapes.

;

;;

;

;For example, mayfly A villain who lives and dies every day, from birth to death in just a short moment, just to bury new seeds, and then use his body as nourishment.

;

;;

;

;For example, as White creatures that are as invisible as chameleons and moths.

;

;;

;

;And those The densely packed and sturdy plants can be opened by a bird feather.

;

;;

;

;Flying The beasts are not running aimlessly, but have the same breathing and rhythm, so the seemingly bulky creatures instantly become extremely light and beautiful.

;

;In fact, it is difficult to say that there is any plot in this animation. The story here is secondary and the creature itself is the main thing.

;

;The plants and animals here have their own beauty and uniqueness. They share the ecosystem of the entire planet, are related to each other, and live in harmony.

;

;;

;

;03;

;At the beginning of the animation, when the spacecraft lost contact, someone reported the situation to the relevant person in charge. The person in charge understands that the top management will not spend manpower and material resources to find a spaceship. Therefore, we can only pray that no one survives, "otherwise they will live an even worse life."

;

;;

;

;;

;

;This is the tone that "Reign" wants to deny, life is like Grass mustard. The entire three lines actually emphasize that life itself is full of meaning.

;

;In the first line, the white uncle Sam has a nakedly hostile, repulsive and exploitative attitude toward alien creatures. He cannot accept unknown creatures and always looks at other creatures from a superior perspective.

;

;When Ursula was shocked by the beauty of the living and dying plant villain, Sam was very angry, feeling that Ursula had deviated from the mission and was irrational.

;

;;

;

;So in this On the planet, Sam seemed out of place. Ursula, on the other hand, seems to be gradually mastering the rhythm of the planet.

;

;She put aside her own prejudices and tried to let perception take precedence, getting to know the planet step by step and discovering its beauty.

;

;The same goes for Archie in the second line. At first, she had no feelings for Levi, only command and control. But gradually, she realized the changes in Levi, and felt the pulse of the planet through Levi's guidance.

;

;Here, artificial intelligence has actually completed the connection with living things earlier than humans, thus guiding humans to return to a state of childlike curiosity.

;

;;

;

;Article 3 The Carmen in this line is different from the first two lines. He reaches a connection with the alien creature Xiao Hei in a way that loses his humanity.

;

;On the one hand, Carmen's use of tools as a human made Xiao Hei quickly become the king of the species. On the other hand, Carmen's obsession with illusions makes Xiao Hei lose the ability to distinguish the truth in the process of using tools.

;

;;

;

;Here, Man has become a captive and a tool, in a lower position, while the little black who enslaved him has reached the top of the food chain. But on the other hand, perhaps in the eyes of other creatures, human beings are like that scary fat little black insect, with endless greed and desire.

;

;;

;

;This drama Although it is a science fiction work, it uses the method of weakening the plot and enlarging the picture to break the anthropocentric thinking path, trying to bring the audience into an almost wild and equal environment, and use imagination to awaken human beings to The awe of life.

;

;Here, the power of technology is hidden, but a kind of primitive vitality is filled with it. Here, no creature is superior to other creatures, and there is no large-scale plundering or killing. Everything is slow and orderly.

;

;So, don’t talk, don’t think, feel first, is the most correct way to open this animation.

;
